Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0215 b) Date of Occurrence: 26/09/2024
c) Installation Details: Nighthawk Stealth - AC-4510-165 at
Sector West Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 03/10/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Turbine Assembly d) Main Assembly: Wing Root Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Turbine Assembly Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PR-9650-C7 h) Sl No.: SN-8800-335
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 17/04/2022 l) Date of Removal: 30/09/2024
Pg No: 90 Ln No: 22 Pg No: 14 Ln No: 6
m) Manufacturing Agency: Apex Defense Manufacturing n) Date, Month & Year June 2019
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2564 Hrs / 893 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Starter generator malfunction. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Design limitation in component load capacity under extreme conditions
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Turbine Assembly component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: N2 - Defect Not Confirmed
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 25/10/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 28/10/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 26/10/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 01/11/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 01/11/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
